info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 1:51PM CDT until August 31 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Fort Bend and Harris.
* WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pearland, Sugar Land, Missouri City, Alvin, Stafford, Bellaire, West University Place, northern Manvel, Fresno, Astrodome Area, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, First Colony, Greater Hobby Area, Meadows Place, Southside Place, Brookside Village, Fort Bend Houston, Fondren Gardens, Central Southwest and Westbury. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
